name: Shrimp Cobb Salad with Cilantro Lime Vinaigrette
description: A light, filling salad loaded with roasted shrimp, bacon bits, and avocado in a tangy, refreshing vinaigrette!
recipeIngredient: Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper (to taste)

recipeInstructions.text: To make the cilantro lime vinaigrette, combine cilantro, lime juice, jalapeño and garlic in the bowl of a food processor; season with salt and pepper, to taste. With the motor running, add olive oil and vinegar in a slow stream until emulsified; set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: To make the cilantro lime vinaigrette, combine cilantro, lime juice, jalapeño and garlic in the bowl of a food processor; season with salt and pepper, to taste. With the motor running, add olive oil and vinegar in a slow stream until emulsified; set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.

recipeInstructions.text: Place shrimp onto the prepared baking sheet. Add olive oil and Emeril’s Essence, and gently toss to combine. Place into oven and roast just until pink, firm and cooked through, about 4-5 minutes; set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Place shrimp onto the prepared baking sheet. Add olive oil and Emeril’s Essence, and gently toss to combine. Place into oven and roast just until pink, firm and cooked through, about 4-5 minutes; set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat a large skillet over medium high heat. Add bacon and cook until brown and crispy, about 6-8 minutes. Transfer to a paper towel-lined plate; set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat a large skillet over medium high heat. Add bacon and cook until brown and crispy, about 6-8 minutes. Transfer to a paper towel-lined plate; set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: Place eggs in a large saucepan and cover with cold water by 1 inch. Bring to a boil and cook for 1 minute. Cover eggs with a tight-fitting lid and remove from heat; set aside for 8-10 minutes. Drain well and let cool before peeling and dicing.
recipeInstructions.name: Place eggs in a large saucepan and cover with cold water by 1 inch. Bring to a boil and cook for 1 minute. Cover eggs with a tight-fitting lid and remove from heat; set aside for 8-10 minutes. Drain well and let cool before peeling and dicing.

recipeInstructions.text: To assemble the salad, place romaine lettuce in a large bowl; top with arranged rows of shrimp, bacon, eggs, avocado, corn and goat cheese.
recipeInstructions.name: To assemble the salad, place romaine lettuce in a large bowl; top with arranged rows of shrimp, bacon, eggs, avocado, corn and goat cheese.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve immediately with cilantro lime vinaigrette.
recipeInstructions.name: Serve immediately with cilantro lime vinaigrette.

review.reviewBody:
This dish was simple to make and super delicious.  I would add chopped tomatoes to beef up the veggies.

If you don't have creole seasoning on hand, the following recipe works well...

Cajun Mix Ingredients to yield 1 Tablespoon

1/2 teaspoon salt
1/2 teaspoon garlic powder 1/2 teaspoons paprika
1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper 
1/4  teaspoon onion powder
1/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper
1/4 teaspoons dried oregano
1/4 teaspoons dried thyme
1/8 teaspoon red pepper flakes

This salad was soooo delicious! The only thing I’d caution folks about is that Creole seasoning tends to have a lot of salt in it. I didn’t have Emeril’s so I used Tony Cachere’s Lite Creole Seasoning which is supposed to have less salt than the original version. Unfortunately, it was still too salty. Between that, the bacon, and the feta, it was just a lot of salt. I probably also added a little too much salt to the dressing, but I don’t think adding less to that would have made much of a difference. Great recipe, next time I’ll make homemade Creole seasoning so I can control the salt. Overall, delicious!!!

will absolutely make this salad again and again! that dressing is everything!!! even though I overcooked the shrimp (it's a terrible habit) the end result was so tasty. would be delicious with other meats, also!
What is the calories per serving?
